subject: Sleep
title: Biphasic Sleep in History
description: Learn Biphasic Sleep in History in one minute.

hook.text: Before the light bulb, people didn't sleep in one block. They had first sleep, woke up, then had second sleep.

buildup.text: Historian Roger Ekirch found hundreds of references to first sleep and second sleep in pre-industrial texts.

discovery.text: People woke for one to two hours in the middle of the night to pray, read, talk, or be intimate.

twist.text: This wakeful period was so normal that medical texts gave advice on the best activities for the midnight gap.

climax.text: Biphasic sleep vanished with artificial lighting, which extended the evening and compressed sleep into one block.

punchline.text: Waking in the middle of the night used to be completely normal.

quiz.question: What was biphasic sleep?
options: Sleeping in two separate blocks with a wakeful period in between
Taking exactly two naps per day
